aoop.asteroids.model

Class Bullet

  • java.lang.Object
    • aoop.asteroids.model.GameObject
      • aoop.asteroids.model.Bullet

  • public class Bullet
extends GameObject
    The bullet is the ultimate weapon of the player. It has the same mechanics as an asteroid, in which it cannot divert from its trajectory. However, the bullet has the addition that it only exists for a certain amount of game steps.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int stepsLeft
      The amount of steps this bullet still is allowed to live.

    • Field Detail

      • stepsLeft

        private int stepsLeft
        The amount of steps this bullet still is allowed to live. When this value drops below 0, the bullet is removed from the game model.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bullet

        public Bullet(java.awt.Point location,
              double velocityX,
              double velocityY)
        Constructs a new bullet using the given location and velocity parame- ters. The amount of steps the bullet gets to live is by default 60.
        Parameters:
        location - location of the bullet.
        velocityX - velocity of the bullet as projected on the X-axis.
        velocityY - velocity of the bullet as projected on the Y-axis.

      • Bullet

        private Bullet(java.awt.Point location,
               double velocityX,
               double velocityY,
               int stepsLeft)
        Constructs a new bullet using the given location and velocity parame- ters. The amount of steps the bullet gets to live is set to the given value. This constructor is primarily used for the clone () method.
        Parameters:
        location - location of the bullet.
        velocityX - velocity of the bullet as projected on the X-axis.
        velocityY - velocity of the bullet as projected on the Y-axis.
        stepsLeft - amount of steps the bullet is allowed to live.
        See Also:
        clone()

    • Method Detail

      • nextStep

        public void nextStep()
        Method that determines the behaviour of the bullet. The behaviour of a bullet is defined by adding the velocity to its location parameters. The location is then restricted to values between 0 and 800 (size of the window).
        Specified by:
        nextStep in class GameObject

      • clone

        public Bullet clone()
        Clones the bullet into an exact copy.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
